content: which are obviously not a kitty and the wacky colors are to make things more visible line up your body parts open ends thread your needle and bring it front to back through both together and pin them in place loops on the neck pull it tightly through same thing with the head insert needle and there you go do that through each back to front through both loops pull stitch all the way around sssseeeewwwwiiiinnnngggg ttttiiiippppssss use straight pins to line up the stitches as much as possible when sewing the head/body seams make sure that you go through both loops on each body part for each stitch practice makes perfect i ve tried pretty much every resource to find the right technique for me believe me i ve come a long way and you will too if you re just starting out face tips put eyes in first don t put the backs on until you re sure that they re even use the eyes to help center the nose and mouth try a few different facial expressions if you re not sure you can pull them out so it s not the end of the world if your kitty looks deranged for a little while ^_^ your kitty needs some clothes hopefully you have some stiff spool lace on hand what i used is the really scratchy stiff cheap-o stuff this helps your kitty stand unroll a bit and here s the step-by-step 1 put the raw edge in the middle of kitty s back line it up so it s under her arms and looks pretty like a dress 2 sew in some anchoring stitches along this raw edge 3 wrap the lace around the kitty 3-4 times to make the dress 4 cut the lace straight so that the cut edge lies in the middle of kitty s back 5 whip stitch the cut edge to the previous layer of lace that you wrapped around kitty 6 make sure that your stitches are tight and you can go back through and sew another line of stitches through all the lace layers and pick up some of kitty s back yarn into that too you can t really see the stitches so make sure she won t have any wardrobe mishaps ooootttthhhheeeerrrr aaaammmmiiiigggguuuurrrruuuummmmiiii ttttiiiippppssss steer clear of any yarn with a sheen to it it s not forgiving at all cheap acrylic yarn is best for beginners throw your metal hook away it will create more pain for you than joy go bamboo i love my clover hook you ll thank me later little mousey pattern * yarn of your choice preferably worsted weight or thicker cheap non-shiny acrylic is best for beginners i used red heart super saver for my mousey you won t need much * crochet hook of your choice-my choice is a bamboo hook size e * plastic animal eyes the pictured mousey has 9mm eyes * embroidery yarn for the face
